docs.lead_paragraph: Seated at an eerily neat desk in a modern office on the grounds of Denmark's state hospital, Dr. Peter C. Gotzsche does not seem a man whose bite is much worse than his very gentle bark. But this tall, gray-haired statistician is sending some eminent doctors into fits of apoplexy as he quietly implies that they've wasted their lives defending old wives' tales, maltreated their patients or assisted in frauds that perhaps ought to land them in jail.

headline.main: A Career That Bristles With Against-the-Grain Conclusions
headline.kicker: CONFRONTING CANCER: SCIENTIST AT WORK -- PETER GOTZSCHE

docs.abstract: Profile of and interview with Danish statistician Dr Peter C Gotzsche, who made headlines with October 2001 Lancet study concluding that major studies of mammography do not show that mammograms can reduce death from breast cancer; photo (M)
